channel.title: Someone help with this?
channel.description:
This is rather annoying, my compiler keep closing too quickly for me to read the errors I receive. I've googled why it wont stay open, and tried all the 'fixes' people say help. None of these have been of help though. :palm:
[code]@echo off taskkill /F /IM java.exe set PATH=%PATH%;ant\bin set JAVA_HOME=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11 ant pause[/code]
nothing wrong with the compiler setup. I have pause at the end as well but It seems to ignore it and close anyways

item.title: Someone help with this?
item.dc:creator: @RSCDevil RSCDevil
item.description:
@RSCDevil wrote:

[quote=“Aleka, post:5, topic:548273”]Nope “ant” works just fine.

@RSCDevil

Try this instead:

In the same folder as your compiler make a text file called “Game_Server_Compile_Log.txt”

@echo off set PATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;ant\bin ant compile > Game_Server_Compile_Log.txt 2>&1 pause

You don’t really need to put in the “set PATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;ant\bin” it just looks neater.

This will out print the errors into your Game_Server_Compile_Log.txt.[/quote]

Thank you so much!!! Works perfect

Read full topic

item.title: Someone help with this?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

cleako:

Save yourself the time and headache when debugging. Install either Eclipse or NetBeans IDE and import your project into it. Let it do the heavy lifting while you focus on the actual code.

Ant can be integrated with both of those IDEs, and can do so much more than just compile for you. So rather than tell him ‘lol use an ide’ give him the help to access the output like Aleka did

Read full topic

item.title: Someone help with this?
item.dc:creator: @Aleka Aleka
item.description:
@Aleka wrote:

Nope “ant” works just fine.

@RSCDevil

Try this instead:

In the same folder as your compiler make a text file called “Game_Server_Compile_Log.txt”

@echo off set PATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;ant\bin ant compile > Game_Server_Compile_Log.txt 2>&1 pause

You don’t really need to put in the “set PATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;ant\bin” it just looks neater.

This will out print the errors into your Game_Server_Compile_Log.txt.

item.title: Someone help with this?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:3, topic:548273”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=667176.msg4461679#msg4461679 date=1417852568]
That’s not a compiler
[/quote]
ant is a build tool, so yes it is a compiler.

OP, type those commands manually in a prompt and see what the error messages are.[/quote]
I don’t think that’s how you use ant tho?? Shouldn’t it be $ant compile

Read full topic
